goal.en: Through the discussion of related topics in the energy field, students could understand: (1) the importance, related issues and analysis theory on balanced development of energy, environment and economic growth. (2) analysis and forecast of international oil price changes; (3) specific quantification methods of environmental costs; (4) policy evaluations and recommendations of Taiwan‘s energy policy (including climate change response, energy transition policy, oil and electricity price policy, etc.)

content.en:
Week Topic
1 Course Introduction
2 Static Criteria for Efficient Energy Resource Allocation (Welfare Analysis and Market Failure)
3 Dynamic Criteria for Efficient Energy Resource Allocation (Investment Theory)
4 World Oil Price and OPEC Behavior
5 Crude Oil Price Analysis and Forecasting
6 Oil Price Fluctuations and Economic Growth
7 Leave Adjustment for Children‘s Day- NO CLASSES
8 The Impact of COVID-19 on Crude Oil Price
9 2050 Taiwan Net Zero Emission Plan
10 A Pragmatic Review of Taiwan’s Energy Transformation Policy
11 Taiwan’s Energy Security Indicators
12 Environmental Economics
13 The Imputation and Study on Energy Externality Cost
14 The Effect and Analysis of Air Pollution and Carbon Tax Fee on Taiwan
15 The Study on Energy Tax, Carbon Tax and Emission Trading System
16 The Study on the Renewable Energy Development Strategy of Taiwan
17 The Effect and Analysis of Oil/ Electricity Market Liberalization
18 Physical Final Exam
